function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Development of new drugs and antibodies may not cover all variations of the human coronavirus, leading to gaps in treatment options.","Impact":"Increased risk of ineffective treatment and failure to address specific strains of the virus.","Mitigation":"Continual research and surveillance for emerging variants of the human coronavirus, as well as ongoing development of new drugs and antibodies.","Technologies":"Biomedical research, genomic sequencing, and drug development technologies.","People":"Researchers, healthcare professionals, and individuals at risk of human coronavirus infection.","Owner":"Research institutions, pharmaceutical companies, and public health organizations."},{"Description":"Synchronous development of ontologies with the appearance of new diseases may lead to gaps in coverage and understanding of specific disease aspects.","Impact":"Incomplete or inaccurate modeling of infectious diseases, hampering research and intervention efforts.","Mitigation":"Regular updates and revisions of ontologies to reflect new knowledge and understanding of diseases, as well as collaborative efforts to ensure comprehensive coverage.","Technologies":"Ontology management tools, expert review panels, and collaborative knowledge sharing platforms.","People":"Ontologists, biomedical researchers, and public health experts.","Owner":"Medical and research institutions, public health agencies, and ontology development organizations."},{"Description":"Dependency on existing ontologies and integration of terms from multiple sources may introduce inconsistencies and errors in the CIDO ontology.","Impact":"Misinterpretation of disease terms, inconsistent data representation, and difficulties in data integration and analysis.","Mitigation":"Thorough validation and verification of integrated terms, standardization of ontology terms, and regular audits for consistency and accuracy.","Technologies":"Ontology validation tools, data integration platforms, and ontology alignment algorithms.","People":"Ontologists, data scientists, and biomedical researchers.","Owner":"Ontology development organizations, research institutions, and biomedical informatics experts."}]}
